result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. BENJAMIN N. TONEY

records.addlTxt:
8:40 AM Defendant BENJAMIN N. TONEY in court.  Attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer in court for BENJAMIN N. TONEY.  Prosecuting attorney Tucker T. Tellefson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  24/7 VIOLATION.  Attorney Patzer requests another date to have time to speak with attorney Folger about removing the 24/7 program.  The State doesn't object.  The Court will adjourn.  Bond Continues. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 10:15 am.

2:15 PM 24/7 VIOLATION HEARING - Defendant BENJAMIN N. TONEY not in court.  Attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer in court for BENJAMIN N. TONEY.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Lynn Folger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  DE doesn't appear, he has had contact with his attorney, thinks he has food poisoning today.  Attorney Patzer requests an adjournment.  The State doesn't object to a brief adjournment.  The Court will adjourn to Monday 10/24.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on October 19, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety. No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia. Comply with the Drug Free 24/7 Program. If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.

2:47 PM Prosecuting attorney Amanda Lynn Folger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant BENJAMIN N. TONEY appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer appeared by video for BENJAMIN N. TONEY. Given/has complaint. Waive reading. Advised of rights. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement. Record closed @ 252
Further proceedings scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:45 am.
